required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Obinutuzumab Evaluating Efficacy, Safety and Cost of Disease Management in Participants With Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia and Comorbidities
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Single Arm, Non-Interventional, Observational Study of Obinutuzumab to Evaluate Efficacy, Safety and Cost of Disease Management in Patients With Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia and Comorbidities in Greece

brief_summary.textblock: This multicenter, single arm, non-interventional, observational study will evaluate the efficacy and safety of obinutuzumab in daily clinical practice in participants with chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL). The study will also assess cost of disease management. The total length of the study is 42 months.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From screening every 6 months to Month 18 until disease progression (up to 24 months)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening every 6 months to Month 18 until disease progression (up to 24 months)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Overall Response as Assessed by Investigator
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening every 6 months to Month 18 until disease progression (up to 24 months)
From screening every 6 months to Month 18 until disease progression (up to 24 months)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Best Overall Response as Assessed by Investigator
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening every 6 months to Month 18 until disease progression (up to 24 months)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Next Treatment, Defined as the Time Between the Date of Enrollment and First Intake of New Anti-Leukemic Therapy

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening every 6 months to Month 18 until disease progression (up to 24 months)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Protocol Defined Adverse Events of Special Interest
Percentage of Participants With Protocol Defined Adverse Events of Particular Interest
Percentage of Participants With Dose Delays/Discontinuations
Percentage of Participants With Hematological Toxicities
Percentage of Participants With Non-hematological Toxicities
Number of Diagnostic and Lab Exams
Number of Medical Procedures (Blood Transfusions, Bone Marrow, or Stem Cell Transplantation)

arm_group.description: Participants will receive obinutuzumab as per Summary of Product Characteristics in daily practice along with chlorambucil for 24 months.

intervention.description: Participants will receive chlorambucil as per summary of product characteristics in daily practice. Protocol does not specify any dosage.
Participants will receive obinutuzumab as per summary of product characteristics in daily practice. Protocol does not specify any dosage.

study_pop.textblock: Participants receiving obinutuzumab for CLL and comorbidities

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants with untreated CLL and comorbidities, for which the physician has already decided to use obinutuzumab in association with chlorambucil
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participation in another clinical trial during the study
